noun.description: An adherent of William Godwin's radical views on politics, social reform, etc.

adjective.description: Relating to or characteristic of Godwin's views.

origin: Late 18th century; earliest use found in Mary Wollstonecraft (1759–1797), author and advocate of women's rights. From the name of William Godwin, British radical (utilitarian and anarchist) political philosopher + -ian.
